name: European Biogas Association
membership: EREF, Eufores, ERGaR, Gas for Climate
goal: The European Biogas Association (EBA) was founded in February 2009 as a Belgian non-profit organization EBA to advocate for recognition of biomethane and other renewable gases as sustainable, on demand and flexible energy sources that provide multiple knock on socio-economic and environmental benefits. EBA’s membership comprises national biogas associations, institutes and companies from all across Europe. The member associations cover the majority of producers, companies, consultants and researchers in the field of biogas within Europe. For more information please visit: www.europeanbiogas.eu
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Taxation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
- Green Deal communications
- Renewable Energy Directive
- Waste Framework Directive
- Fertilisers Regulation
- Future of gas
- Waste-to-energy policies
- Guidelines on State aid for environmental protection and energy
- Revision of BREF for Waste Treatment Industries
- Direcive on Alternative Fuels Infrastructure
- CO2 emission standards for vehicles
